New Records: Harry Kane marked his 100th England cap with two goals.
Key Match Events: Harry Kane scored the first goal in the 57th minute with an unstoppable drive into the roof of the net.
Harry Kane scored his second goal 14 minutes from the end with a clever first-time finish following a square pass from substitute Noni Madueke.
Post-Match Reflections: Harry Kane described his 100th cap for England as a 'pretty much perfect' night after scoring both goals in the 2-0 win over Finland.
Kane expressed pride in his performance and the team's victory, highlighting the significance of his milestone and his desire to keep pushing boundaries.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Harry Kane was presented with a golden cap by fellow England centurions Frank Lampard and Ashley Cole in a special ceremony before kick-off at Wembley.
The victory means England have started Lee Carsley's reign with two wins from their opening two Nations League matches.
